spirit:busInterface.spirit:name: AHB_Master1
spirit:busInterface.spirit:description: Bus Master side of the AHB. On this interface the 'consumer's are AHB masters, and the 'provider' is the central bus IP.

spirit:busInterface.spirit:name: AHB_Slave
spirit:busInterface.spirit:description: Bus Slave side of the AHB. On this interface the 'consumer's are AHB slaves, and the 'provider' is the central bus IP.

spirit:busInterface.spirit:name: HCLK
spirit:busInterface.spirit:description: Clock signal for AHB masters and slaves. Connections typically go from an exported interface to each AHB master/slave and the bus itself.

spirit:busInterface.spirit:name: HRESETn
spirit:busInterface.spirit:description: Reset signal for AHB masters and slaves. Connections typically go from an exported interface to each AHB master/slave and the bus itself.

spirit:busInterface.spirit:name: int_combined
spirit:busInterface.spirit:description: Source interrupt signals connected to an interrupt controller.

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: USE_FOUNDATION
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: USE_FOUNDATION. The component code utilizes DesignWare Foundation parts for optimal Synthesis QoR. Customers with only a DesignWare license MUST use Foundation parts. Customers with only a Source license, CANNOT use Foundation parts. Customers with both Source and DesignWare licenses have the option of using Foundation parts.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Use DesignWare Foundation Synthesis Library

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_NUM_MASTER_INT
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_NUM_MASTER_INT. Number of AHB master interfaces. A channel's source and destination device can be programmed to be on any of the configured AHB layer's attached to the AHB Master interfaces. This setting determines if a master interface's signal set is present on the I/O or not. AHB master 1 interface signals are always present.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Number of AHB master interfaces

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_NUM_CHANNELS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_NUM_CHANNELS. Number Of DMA channels. Each channel is uni-directional and transfers data from the channel's source to the channel's destination. The channel's source and destination AHB layer, system address and handshaking interface are under software control.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Number of DMA channels

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_NUM_HS_INT
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_NUM_HS_INT. Number of handshaking interfaces. Each channel's source and destination can be assigned a handshaking interface. This is under software control. If 0 is selected then no hardware handshaking interface signals will be present on the I/O.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Number of handshaking interfaces

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_ID_NUM
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_ID_NUM. This 32-bit value is hardwired and read back by a read to the DMA Controller ID Register (DmaldReg).

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: ID number

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_INTR_POL
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_INTR_POL. Interrupt active polarity for all of the configured interrupt ports. When this box is selected the interrupt polarity for all interrupt pins on the I/O interface is active low. When this box is de-selected the interrupt polarity for all interrupt pins on the I/O interface is active high.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Interrupts are active high?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_INTR_IO
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_INTR_IO. Selects which interrupt related pins appear as outputs of the design.
all - Contents of all five Interrupts Status Registers appear as output pins on int(_n) output bus. 5 * DMAH_NUM_CHANNELS bits wide.
type - All internal interrupts are combined by type and appear on int_flag(_n) output bus. 5 bit bus.
bit[4] = Error interrupt bit[3] = Destination transaction complete interrupt bit[2] = Source transaction complete interrupt bit[1] = Block complete interrupt bit[0] = Transfer complete interrupt
Bitwise OR of all bits of int_flag(_n) bus is also driven onto the int_combined single bit output port.
combined - Bitwise OR of all bits of int_flag(_n) bus is driven onto the int_combined(_n) single bit output port.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Interrupt pins to appear as outputs

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_MABRST
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_MABRST. Selecting this box will allow software to limit the maximum AMBA burst length to a value under software control. This is a global parameter for all of the configured master interfaces. If this box is not selected then software cannot limit the the maximum AMBA burst length. The maximum possible AMBA burst length in this case will be determined by the depth of the channel FIFO's as the DMA controller may try to fill/empty the channel FIFO in a single AMBA burst. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Allow the AMBA burst length to be limited to a programmable maximum value?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_INCR_BURSTS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_INCR_BURSTS. When this option is selected then all bursts will be undefined length bursts. When this option is not selected then all bursts will be defined length bursts.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Use undefined length bursts only?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_RETURN_ERR_RESP
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_RETURN_ERR_RESP. Selecting this box will allow the slave interface to return an error response on the hresp bus when an illegal access is attempted over the AHB slave interface. An illegal access is any of the following:
1. An AMBA transfer of hsize > 64 bits is attempted. 2. hsel is asserted but the address does not decode to a valid address. 3. A write to the sar, dar, ctl, llp, sstat, dstat, sstatar and dstatar registers is attempted when the channel is enabled. 4. A read from the interrupt clear registers, ClearTfr, ClearBlock, ClearSrcTran, ClearDstTran, ClearErr is attempted. 5. A write to the Interrupt status registers, StatusTfr, StatusBlock, StatusSrcTran, StatusDstTran, StatusErr is attempted. 6. A write to the StatusInt register is attempted. 7. A write to either the DmaIdReg or DmaVersionId registers is attempted.
De-selecting this box will result in an O.K. response been returned on the hresp bus for all off the illegal access's listed above. Note in both cases an illegal read will read back 0 and an illegal write will be ignored.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Allow the slave interface to return an error response when an illegal access is attempted?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_ADD_ENCODED_PARAMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: Adding the encoded parameters gives firmware an easy and quick way of identifying the DesignWare component within an I/O memory map. Some critical design-time options determine how a driver should interact with the peripheral. There is a minimal area overhead when you include these parameters. Additionally, this option allows a self-configurable single driver to be developed for each component.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Add encoded parameters

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_STATIC_ENDIAN_SELECT
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_STATIC_ENDIAN_SELECT. The endianness of the DW_ahb_dmac can be configured statically through coreConsultant or dynamically via pins on the I/O - For the static case there is a single coreConsultant parameter that controls the endianness of all AHB master interfaces and the AHB slave interface. For the dynamic case there is an individual pin for each of the AHB master interfaces and one for the AHB slave interface.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Statically configure endianness through coreConsultant?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_BIG_ENDIAN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_BIG_ENDIAN. The AHB master interfaces and the AHB slave interface can be configured to exist in either a big or little endian system. All master interfaces and the AHB slave interface have the same endianness. If this box is selected then all configured AHB master interfaces and the AHB slave interface will be configured to be big endian. If this box is de-selected then all configured AHB master interfaces and the AHB slave interface will be configured to be little endian.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: System is big endian?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_S_HDATA_WIDTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_S_HDATA_WIDTH. Slave interface data bus width.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Slave interface data bus width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M1_AHB_LITE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M1_AHB_LITE. Select this box if master interface 1 is the only master on this AMBA layer. If this is the case then this is an AMBA-Lite layer. De-select this box if there is more than one master on this AMBA layer.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Is Layer 1 AMBA-Lite?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M1_HDATA_WIDTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M1_HDATA_WIDTH. Master 1 interface data bus width.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Master 1 interface data bus width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M2_AHB_LITE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M2_AHB_LITE. Select this box if master interface 2 is the only master on this AMBA layer. If this is the case then this is an AMBA-Lite layer. De-select this box if there is more than one master on this AMBA layer.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Is Layer 2 AMBA-Lite?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M2_HDATA_WIDTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M2_HDATA_WIDTH. Master 2 interface data bus width.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Master 2 interface data bus width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M3_AHB_LITE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M3_AHB_LITE. Select this box if master interface 3 is the only master on this AMBA layer. If this is the case then this is an AMBA-Lite layer. De-select this box if there is more than one master on this AMBA layer.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Is Layer 3 AMBA-Lite?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M3_HDATA_WIDTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M3_HDATA_WIDTH. Master 3 interface data bus width.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Master 3 interface data bus width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M4_AHB_LITE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M4_AHB_LITE. Select this box if master interface 4 is the only master on this AMBA layer. If this is the case then this is an AMBA-Lite layer. De-select this box if there is more than one master on this AMBA layer.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Is Layer 4 AMBA-Lite?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_M4_HDATA_WIDTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_M4_HDATA_WIDTH. Master 4 interface data bus width.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Master 4 interface data bus width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_FIFO_DEPTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_FIFO_DEPTH. Channel 0 FIFO depth in bytes.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Channel 0 FIFO depth in bytes

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_MAX_MULT_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_MAX_MULT_SIZE. Maximum value of burst transaction size that can be programmed for channel 0. Programming either of the ctl0.src_msize or ctl0.dest_msize registers to a value greater than this cC constant will result in erroneous behavior. Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum value of burst transaction size

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_MAX_BLK_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH0_MAX_BLK_SIZE. The behavior of this cC constant is dependent on the assignment of the flow control peripheral.
1. DMA is flow controller
Maximum block length, in multiples off source transfer width, that can be programmed for channel 0. A programmed value greater than this will result in erroneous behavior.
2. Either of the source or destination peripherals assigned as flow controller
In this case the blocks can be greater than DMAH_CH0_MAX_BLK_SIZE but the logic that keeps track of the length of the block saturates at DMAH_CH0_MAX_BLK_SIZE. This will not result in erroneous behavior but a readback of the block size will be incorrect when blocks exceed the saturated value.
This parameter is also used to limit channel 0's scatter and gather count registers to hold a maximum value of DMAH_CH0_MAX_BLK_SIZE.
Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum block size in source transfer widths

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_FC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH0_FC. Hardcode the flow control peripheral for channel 0. Hardcoding the flow control peripheral will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.
DMA_FC : Hardcodes the DMA as the block flow controlling device SRC_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the source peripheral as the block flow controlling device DST_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the destination peripheral as the block flow controlling device ANY_FC : Does not hardcode the block flow control device and allows software to select the block flow control device.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 0's flow control device to allow for logic optimization

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_LOCK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_LOCK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable channel or bus level locking on channel 0. When enabled, then software can program the DMA controller to assert hlock over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. When enabled, then software can also program the DMA controller to lock the arbitration for the master bus interface unit over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. De-selecting this option allows for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable channel or bus locking on channel 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_SMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_SMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the source of channel 0. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the source of channel 0 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the source of channel 0

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_DMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_DMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the destination of channel 0. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the destination of channel 0 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the destination of channel 0

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_STW
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_STW. Hardcode the source transfer width for transfers from the source of channel 0. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the source transfer width for channel 0. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 0's source transfer width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_DTW
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_DTW. Hardcode the destination transfer width for transfers from the destination of channel 0. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the destination transfer width for channel 0. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 0's destination transfer width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_SRC_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_SRC_NON_OK. Should be selected if the source peripheral attached to channel 0 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split, retry or error response. If this box is de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the source of channel 0. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the source of channel 0 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_DST_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_DST_NON_OK. Should be selected if the destination peripheral attached to channel 0 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split, retry or error response. If this box is de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the destination of channel 0. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the destination of channel 0 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_MULTI_BLK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_MULTI_BLK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 0. If this option is de-selected then hardware will hardwire channel 0 to do single block transfers only. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_HC_LLP
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH0_HC_LLP. If the Linked List Pointer ( LLP ) register is hardcoded to 0 then this will disable the following features on channel 0: 1. Multi-block DMA transfers using block chaining 2. Source and destination status fetch 3. Control and source/destination status writeback
Multi-block DMA transfers may still be enabled on channel 0 through auto-reloading of channel registers. Selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode Channel 0 LLP register to 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_MULTI_BLK_TYPE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH0_MULTI_BLK_TYPE. This parameter allows the user to hardcode the type of multi-block transfers that the DW_ahb_dmac can perform. This will result in some logic optimization of the implementation.
NO_HARDCODE : Allow all types of multi-block support
CONT_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0 is contigious, DAR0 and CTL0 are reloaded from their initial values
RELOAD_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0 and CTL0 are reloaded from their initial values, DAR0 is contigious
RELOAD_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0,DAR0 and CTL0 are reloaded from their initial values
CONT_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0 is contigious, DAR0,CTL0 and LLP0 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
RELOAD_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0 is reloaded from it's initial value, DAR0,CTL0 and LLP0 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
LLP_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0,CTL0 and LLP0 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR0 is contigious
LLP_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0,CTL0 and LLP0 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR0 is reloaded from it's initial values
LLP_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR0,DAR0,CTL0 and LLP0 are loaded from the next

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Choose type of multi-blocks to be supported?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_STAT_SRC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_STAT_SRC. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the source peripheral of channel 0 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the source status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from source of channel 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_STAT_DST
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_STAT_DST. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the destination peripheral of channel 0 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the destination status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from destination of channel 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_LMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_LMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the Linked List Pointer (LLP) peripheral of channel 0. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the LLP peripheral of channel 0 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the LLP peripheral of channel 0

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_LLP_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_LLP_NON_OK. Should be selected if the linked list pointer (LLP) peripheral attached to channel 0 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split, retry or error response. If de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the LLP peripheral of channel 0. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the LLP peripheral of channel 0 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_SRC_GAT_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_SRC_GAT_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable the 'gather' feature on channel 0. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable the 'gather' feature on channel 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_DST_SCA_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_DST_SCA_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable the 'scatter' feature on channel 0. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH0_CTL_WB_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH0_CTL_WB_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable writeback of the control register at the end of every block transfer. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable control register writeback after each block transfer?

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Channel 1 FIFO depth in bytes

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_MULTI_BLK_TYPE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH1_MULTI_BLK_TYPE. This parameter allows the user to hardcode the type of multi-block transfers that the DW_ahb_dmac can perform. This will result in some logic optimization of the implementation.
NO_HARDCODE : Allow all types of multi-block support
CONT_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1 is contigious, DAR1 and CTL1 are reloaded from their initial values
RELOAD_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1 and CTL1 are reloaded from their initial values, DAR1 is contigious
RELOAD_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1,DAR1 and CTL1 are reloaded from their initial values
CONT_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1 is contigious, DAR1,CTL1 and LLP1 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
RELOAD_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1 is reloaded from it's initial value, DAR1,CTL1 and LLP1 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
LLP_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1,CTL1 and LLP1 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR1 is contigious
LLP_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1,CTL1 and LLP1 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR1 is reloaded from it's initial values
LLP_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR1,DAR1,CTL1 and LLP1 are loaded from the next

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Choose type of multi-blocks to be supported?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_HC_LLP
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH1_HC_LLP. If the Linked List Pointer ( LLP ) register is hardcoded to 0 then this will disable the following features on channel 1: 1. Multi-block DMA transfers using block chaining 2. Source and destination status fetch 3. Control and source/destination status writeback
Multi-block DMA transfers may still be enabled on channel 1 through auto-reloading of channel registers. Selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode Channel 1 LLP register to 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_STAT_SRC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH1_STAT_SRC. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the source peripheral of channel 1 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the source status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from source of channel 1?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_STAT_DST
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH1_STAT_DST. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the destination peripheral of channel 1 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the destination status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from destination of channel 1?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_LMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH1_LMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the Linked List Pointer (LLP) peripheral of channel 1. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the LLP peripheral of channel 1 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the LLP peripheral of channel 1

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_LLP_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH1_LLP_NON_OK. Should be selected to true if the linked list pointer (LLP) peripheral attached to channel 1 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split, retry or error response. If de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the LLP peripheral of channel 1. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the LLP peripheral of channel 1 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_SRC_GAT_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH1_SRC_GAT_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable the 'gather' feature on channel 1. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable the 'gather' feature on channel 1?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_DST_SCA_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH1_DST_SCA_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable the 'scatter' feature on channel 1. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable the 'scatter' feature on channel 1?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH1_CTL_WB_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH1_CTL_WB_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable writeback of the control register at the end of every block transfer. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable control writeback after each block transfer?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_FIFO_DEPTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_FIFO_DEPTH. Channel 2 FIFO depth in bytes.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Channel 2 FIFO depth in bytes

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_MAX_MULT_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_MAX_MULT_SIZE. Maximum value of burst transaction size that can be programmed for channel 2. Programming either of the ctl2.src_msize or ctl2.dest_msize registers to a value greater than this cC constant will result in erroneous behavior. Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum value of burst transaction size

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_MAX_BLK_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH2_MAX_BLK_SIZE. The behavior of this cC constant is dependent on the assignment of the flow control peripheral.
1. DMA is flow controller
Maximum block length, in multiples off source transfer width, that can be programmed for channel 2. A programmed value greater than this will result in erroneous behavior.
2. Either of the source or destination peripherals assigned as flow controller
In this case the blocks can be greater than DMAH_CH2_MAX_BLK_SIZE but the logic that keeps track of the length of the block saturates at DMAH_CH2_MAX_BLK_SIZE. This will not result in erroneous behavior but a readback of the block size will be incorrect when blocks exceed the saturated value.
This parameter is also used to limit channel 2's scatter and gather count registers to hold a maximum value of DMAH_CH2_MAX_BLK_SIZE.
Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum block size in source transfer widths

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_FC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH2_FC. Hardcode the flow control peripheral for channel 2. Hardcoding the flow control peripheral will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.
DMA_FC : Hardcodes the DMA as the block flow controlling device SRC_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the source peripheral as the block flow controlling device DST_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the destination peripheral as the block flow controlling device ANY_FC : Does not hardcode the block flow control device and allows software to select the block flow control device.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 2's flow control device to allow for logic optimization

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_LOCK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_LOCK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable channel or bus level locking on channel 2. When enabled, then software can program the DMA controller to assert hlock over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. When enabled, then software can also program the DMA controller to lock the arbitration for the master bus interface unit over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. De-selecting this option allows for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable channel or bus locking on channel 2?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_SMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_SMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the source of channel 2. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the source of channel 2 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the source of channel 2

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_DMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_DMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the destination of channel 2. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the destination of channel 2 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the destination of channel 2

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_STW
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_STW. Hardcode the source transfer width for transfers from the source of channel 2. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the source transfer width for channel 2. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 2's source transfer width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_DTW
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_DTW. Hardcode the destination transfer width for transfers from the destination of channel 2. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the destination transfer width for channel 2. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 2's destination transfer width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_SRC_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_SRC_NON_OK. Should be selected if the source peripheral attached to channel 2 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split/retry or error response. If this box is de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the source of channel 2. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the source of channel 2 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_DST_NON_OK

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the destination of channel 2 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_MULTI_BLK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH2_MULTI_BLK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 2. If this option is de-selected then hardware will hardwire channel 2 to do single block transfers only. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 2?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH2_MULTI_BLK_TYPE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH2_MULTI_BLK_TYPE. This parameter allows the user to hardcode the type of multi-block transfers that the DW_ahb_dmac can perform. This will result in some logic optimization of the implementation.
NO_HARDCODE : Allow all types of multi-block support
CONT_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2 is contigious, DAR2 and CTL2 are reloaded from their initial values
RELOAD_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2 and CTL2 are reloaded from their initial values, DAR2 is contigious
RELOAD_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2,DAR2 and CTL2 are reloaded from their initial values
CONT_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2 is contigious, DAR2,CTL2 and LLP2 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
RELOAD_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2 is reloaded from it's initial value, DAR2,CTL2 and LLP2 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
LLP_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2,CTL2 and LLP2 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR2 is contigious
LLP_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2,CTL2 and LLP2 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR2 is reloaded from it's initial values
LLP_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR2,DAR2,CTL2 and LLP2 are loaded from the next

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Choose type of multi-blocks to be supported?

spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_DTW. Hardcode the destination transfer width for transfers from the destination of channel 4. spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_SRC_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_SRC_NON_OK. Should be selected if the source peripheral attached to channel 4 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split/retry or error response. If this box is de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the source of channel 4. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_MULTI_BLK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_MULTI_BLK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 4. If this option is de-selected then hardware will hardwire channel 4 to do single block transfers only. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 4?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_MULTI_BLK_TYPE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH4_MULTI_BLK_TYPE. This parameter allows the user to hardcode the type of multi-block transfers that the DW_ahb_dmac can perform. This will result in some logic optimization of the implementation.
NO_HARDCODE : Allow all types of multi-block support
CONT_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4 is contigious, DAR4 and CTL4 are reloaded from their initial values
RELOAD_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4 and CTL4 are reloaded from their initial values, DAR4 is contigious
RELOAD_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4,DAR4 and CTL4 are reloaded from their initial values
CONT_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4 is contigious, DAR4,CTL4 and LLP4 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
RELOAD_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4 is reloaded from it's initial value, DAR4,CTL4 and LLP4 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
LLP_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4,CTL4 and LLP4 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR4 is contigious
LLP_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4,CTL4 and LLP4 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR4 is reloaded from it's initial values
LLP_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR4,DAR4,CTL4 and LLP4 are loaded from the next

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Choose type of multi-blocks to be supported?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_HC_LLP
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH4_HC_LLP. If the Linked List Pointer ( LLP ) register is hardcoded to 0 then this will disable the following features on channel 4: 1. Multi-block DMA transfers using block chaining 2. Source and destination status fetch 3. Control and source/destination status writeback
Multi-block DMA transfers may still be enabled on channel 4 through auto-reloading of channel registers. Selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode Channel 4 LLP register to 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_STAT_SRC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_STAT_SRC. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the source peripheral of channel 4 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the source status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from source of channel 4?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_STAT_DST
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_STAT_DST. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the destination peripheral of channel 0 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the destination status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from destination of channel 4?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_LMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_LMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the Linked List Pointer (LLP) peripheral of channel 4. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the LLP peripheral of channel 4 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the LLP peripheral of channel 4

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_LLP_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_LLP_NON_OK. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH4_CTL_WB_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH4_CTL_WB_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable writeback of the control register at the end of every block transfer. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable control writeback after each block transfer?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH5_FIFO_DEPTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH5_FIFO_DEPTH. Channel 5 FIFO depth in bytes.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Channel 5 FIFO depth in bytes

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH5_MAX_MULT_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH5_MAX_MULT_SIZE. Maximum value of burst transaction size that can be programmed for channel 5. Programming either of the ctl5.src_msize or ctl5.dest_msize registers to a value greater than this cC constant will result in erroneous behavior. Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum value of burst transaction size

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH5_MAX_BLK_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH5_MAX_BLK_SIZE. The behavior of this cC constant is dependent on the assignment of the flow control peripheral.
1. DMA is flow controller
Maximum block length, in multiples off source transfer width, that can be programmed for channel 5. A programmed value greater than this will result in erroneous behavior.
2. Either of the source or destination peripherals assigned as flow controller
In this case the blocks can be greater than DMAH_CH5_MAX_BLK_SIZE but the logic that keeps track of the length of the block saturates at DMAH_CH5_MAX_BLK_SIZE. This will not result in erroneous behavior but a readback of the block size will be incorrect when blocks exceed the saturated value.
This parameter is also used to limit channel 5's scatter and gather count registers to hold a maximum value of DMAH_CH5_MAX_BLK_SIZE.
Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum block size in source transfer widths

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH5_FC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH5_FC. Hardcode the flow control peripheral for channel 5. Hardcoding the flow control peripheral will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.
DMA_FC : Hardcodes the DMA as the block flow controlling device SRC_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the source peripheral as the block flow controlling device DST_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the destination peripheral as the block flow controlling device ANY_FC : Does not hardcode the block flow control device and allows software to select the block flow control device.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 5's flow control device to allow for logic optimization

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH5_LOCK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH5_LOCK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable channel or bus level locking on channel 5. When enabled, then software can program the DMA controller to assert hlock over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. When enabled, then software can also program the DMA controller to lock the arbitration for the master bus interface unit over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. De-selecting this option allows for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable channel or bus locking on channel 5?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH6_CTL_WB_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH6_CTL_WB_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable writeback of the control register at the end of every block transfer. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable control writeback after each block transfer?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_FIFO_DEPTH
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_FIFO_DEPTH. Channel 7 FIFO depth in bytes.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Channel 7 FIFO depth in bytes

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_MAX_MULT_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_MAX_MULT_SIZE. Maximum value of burst transaction size that can be programmed for channel 7. Programming either of the ctl7.src_msize or ctl7.dest_msize registers to a value greater than this cC constant will result in erroneous behavior. Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum value of burst transaction size

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_MAX_BLK_SIZE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH7_MAX_BLK_SIZE. The behavior of this cC constant is dependent on the assignment of the flow control peripheral.
1. DMA is flow controller
Maximum block length, in multiples off source transfer width, that can be programmed for channel 7. A programmed value greater than this will result in erroneous behavior.
2. Either of the source or destination peripherals assigned as flow controller
In this case the blocks can be greater than DMAH_CH7_MAX_BLK_SIZE but the logic that keeps track of the length of the block saturates at DMAH_CH7_MAX_BLK_SIZE. This will not result in erroneous behavior but a readback of the block size will be incorrect when blocks exceed the saturated value.
This parameter is also used to limit channel 7's scatter and gather count registers to hold a maximum value of DMAH_CH7_MAX_BLK_SIZE.
Limiting this value with a cC constant will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Maximum block size in source transfer widths

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_FC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH7_FC. Hardcode the flow control peripheral for channel 7. Hardcoding the flow control peripheral will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.
DMA_FC : Hardcodes the DMA as the block flow controlling device SRC_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the source peripheral as the block flow controlling device DST_FC_ONLY : Hardcodes the destination peripheral as the block flow controlling device ANY_FC : Does not hardcode the block flow control device and allows software to select the block flow control device.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 7's flow control device to allow for logic optimization

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_LOCK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_LOCK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable channel or bus level locking on channel 7. When enabled, then software can program the DMA controller to assert hlock over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. When enabled, then software can also program the DMA controller to lock the arbitration for the master bus interface unit over the DMA transfer, DMA block transfer or DMA transaction. De-selecting this option allows for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable channel or bus locking on channel 7?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_SMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_SMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the source of channel 7. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the source of channel 7 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the source of channel 7

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_DMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_DMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the destination of channel 7. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the destination of channel 7 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the destination of channel 7

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_STW
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_STW. Hardcode the source transfer width for transfers from the source of channel 7. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the source transfer width for channel 7. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 7's source transfer width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_DTW
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_DTW. Hardcode the destination transfer width for transfers from the destination of channel 7. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the destination transfer width for channel 7. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode channel 7's destination transfer width

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_SRC_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_SRC_NON_OK. Should be selected if the source peripheral attached to channel 7 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split/retry or error response. If this box is de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the source of channel 7. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the source of channel 7 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_DST_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_DST_NON_OK. Should be selected if the destination peripheral attached to channel 7 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split/retry or error response. If this box is de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the destination of channel 7. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the destination of channel 7 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_MULTI_BLK_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_MULTI_BLK_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 7. If this option is de-selected then hardware will hardwire channel 7 to do single block transfers only. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable multi-block DMA transfers on channel 7?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_MULTI_BLK_TYPE
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH7_MULTI_BLK_TYPE. This parameter allows the user to hardcode the type of multi-block transfers that the DW_ahb_dmac can perform. This will result in some logic optimization of the implementation.
NO_HARDCODE : Allow all types of multi-block support
CONT_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7 is contigious, DAR7 and CTL7 are reloaded from their initial values
RELOAD_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7 and CTL7 are reloaded from their initial values, DAR7 is contigious
RELOAD_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7,DAR7 and CTL7 are reloaded from their initial values
CONT_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7 is contigious, DAR7,CTL7 and LLP7 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
RELOAD_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7 is reloaded from it's initial value, DAR7,CTL7 and LLP7 are loaded from the next Linked List Item
LLP_CONT : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7,CTL7 and LLP7 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR7 is contigious
LLP_RELOAD : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7,CTL7 and LLP7 are loaded from the next Linked List Item, DAR7 is reloaded from it's initial values
LLP_LLP : Allow only multi-block transfers where SAR7,DAR7,CTL7 and LLP7 are loaded from the next

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Choose type of multi-blocks to be supported?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_HC_LLP
spirit:parameter.spirit:description:
DMAH_CH7_HC_LLP. If the Linked List Pointer ( LLP ) register is hardcoded to 0 then this will disable the following features on channel 7: 1. Multi-block DMA transfers using block chaining 2. Source and destination status fetch 3. Control and source/destination status writeback
Multi-block DMA transfers may still be enabled on channel 7 through auto-reloading of channel registers. Selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode Channel 7 LLP register to 0?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_STAT_SRC
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_STAT_SRC. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the source peripheral of channel 7 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the source status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from source of channel 7?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_STAT_DST
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_STAT_DST. Include or exclude logic to fetch a status register from the destination peripheral of channel 7 and write this status information to system memory at the end of each block transfer. The location from where the destination status register is fetched from is under software control as is the writeback location. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Fetch status from destination of channel 7?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_LMS
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_LMS. Hardcode the Master interface attached to the Linked List Pointer (LLP) peripheral of channel 7. If this is not hardcoded then software can program the LLP peripheral of channel 7 to be attached to any of the configured layers. Hardcoding this value will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Hardcode the master interface attached to the LLP peripheral of channel 7

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_LLP_NON_OK
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_LLP_NON_OK. Should be selected to true if the linked list pointer (LLP) peripheral attached to channel 7 can return a non-ok response on hresp. i.e. either split, retry or error response. If de-selected then hardware assumes that only o.k. responses will be returned from the LLP peripheral of channel 7. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Can the LLP peripheral of channel 7 return a non-ok response on hresp?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_SRC_GAT_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_SRC_GAT_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable the 'gather' feature on channel 7. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable the 'gather' feature on channel 7?

spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_DST_SCA_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable the 'scatter' feature on channel 7. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable 'scatter' feature on channel 7?

spirit:parameter.spirit:name: DMAH_CH7_CTL_WB_EN
spirit:parameter.spirit:description: DMAH_CH7_CTL_WB_EN. Include or exclude logic to enable writeback of the control register at the end of every block transfer. De-selecting this box will allow for some logic optimization of the implementation.

spirit:value.spirit:prompt: Include logic to enable control writeback after each block transfer?
